  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">Our cash, cash equivalents,
  and short-term investments consist principally of money market mutual funds,
  municipal bonds, and various equity investments. All of our cash equivalents
  and short-term investments are classified as available-for-sale under the
  provisions of SFAS 115, &#147;Accounting for Certain Investments in Debt and
  Equity Securities.&#148; The securities are carried at fair value with the
  unrealized gains and losses, net of tax, included in accumulated other
  comprehensive income, which is reflected as a separate component of
  stockholders' equity.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">Our cash, cash equivalents,
  and short-term investments increased $129.5 million, or 26.0%, from December
  3, 1999, primarily due to cash generated from operations of $294.3 million,
  proceeds from the issuance of treasury stock related to the exercise of stock
  options under our stock option plans and the issuance of treasury stock under
  the Employee Stock Purchase Plan of $87.5 million, proceeds from the sale of
  other companies' equity securities totaling $13.3 million, and the sale of a
  corporate facility in Scotland for $5.4 million. In addition, short-term
  investments increased due to a reclassification of $48.7 million of
  investments classified as long-term to short-term and mark-to-market
  adjustments on those short-term investments of $21.9 million.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">These factors were partially
  offset by the purchase of treasury stock in the amount of $234.6 million, the
  purchase of other assets for $77.9 million, capital expenditures of $17.5
  million, the payment of dividends totaling $9.0 million, and the effect of
  foreign currency exchange rates totaling $1.8 million.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">We expect to continue our
  investing activities, including expenditures for computer systems for research
  and development, sales and marketing, product support, and administrative
  staff. Furthermore, cash reserves may be used to purchase treasury stock and
  acquire software companies, products, or technologies that are complementary
  to our business.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">We have paid cash dividends on
  our common stock each quarter since the second quarter of 1988. Adobe's
  Board of Directors declared a cash dividend on our common stock of $0.025 per
  common share for the first, second, and third quarters of fiscal 2000. The
  declaration of future dividends, whether in cash or in-kind, is within the
  discretion of Adobe's&nbsp;</font></p>
  <p align="center"><font size="2">24</font></p>
  <hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">



  <p><font size="2"> Board of Directors and will depend on business
  conditions, our results of operations and financial condition, and other
  factors.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">In April 1999, Adobe's Board
  of Directors authorized, subject to certain business and market conditions,
  the purchase of up to an additional 5.0 million shares of our common stock
  over a two-year period. This new stock repurchase program was in addition to
  an existing program whereby we have been authorized to repurchase shares to
  offset issuances under employee stock option and stock purchase plans. As of
  September 1, 2000, no purchases have been made under the 5.0 million share
  repurchase program.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">Under our existing plan to
  repurchase shares to offset issuances under employee stock plans, we
  repurchased approximately 3.4 million shares in the first nine months of
  fiscal 2000 at a cost of $234.6 million. During the first nine months of
  fiscal 1999, we repurchased 8.0 million shares at a cost of $273.1 million.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">In addition, during fiscal
  1999, 1.7 million shares were repurchased at a cost of $30.5 million under
  another share repurchase program, in which Adobe's Board of Directors
  authorized the repurchase of up to 30.0 million shares. This share repurchase
  program was completed during the first quarter of fiscal 1999.</font></p>

<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">To facilitate our stock
repurchase program, we sold put warrants to independent third parties in the
third quarter of fiscal 2000. Each put warrant entitles the holder to sell one
share of our common stock to us at a specified price. On September 1, 2000, put
warrants to sell approximately 0.3 million shares of our common stock were
outstanding that expire in September 2000 with an average exercise price of
$96.20 per share.</font></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">In addition, we purchased call
options from independent third parties that entitle us to buy shares of our
common stock on certain dates at specified prices. On September 1, 2000, call
options to purchase approximately 0.2 million shares were outstanding that
expire in September 2000 with an average exercise price of $104.00 per share.
Under these arrangements, at our option, we can settle with physical delivery or
net shares equal to the difference between the exercise price and the value of
the option as determined by the contract.</font></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">We believe that existing cash,
cash equivalents, and short-term investments, together with cash generated from
operations, will provide sufficient funds for us to meet our operating cash
requirements in the foreseeable future.</font></p>
<p><b><font size="2">Commitments</font></b></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">Our principal commitments as of
September 1, 2000 consist of obligations under operating leases, line of credit
agreements, venture investing activities, and various service agreements.</font></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">We replaced, for one year, a
$100.0 million unsecured revolving line of credit, which expired in August 2000.
The terms, covenants, and margins of the new facility are substantially the same
as the expiring facility.</font></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">We believe that if either or
both of the lines of credit are canceled or amounts are not available under the
lines, there would not be a material adverse effect on our financial results,
liquidity, or capital resources.</font></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">Under the terms of the lines of
credit and the lease agreement, we may pay cash dividends unless an event of
default has occurred or we do not meet certain financial ratios.</font></p>
<p><b><font size="2"><a name=QQDMR></A>Item 3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Quantitative and
Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk</font></b></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">We hold equity investments in
several publicly traded companies, which are subject to considerable market risk
due to market price volatility. These securities are generally classified as
available-for-sale and are recorded on the balance sheet at fair value, with
unrealized gains or losses reported as a separate component of accumulated other
comprehensive income, net of tax. We have also invested in privately held
companies, many of which can still be considered in the startup or development
stages. These investments are inherently risky as the market for the
technologies or products they have under development are typically in the early
stages and may never materialize. We could lose a substantial part of or our
entire initial investment in these companies.</font></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">Please refer to our market risk
disclosures set forth in our 1999 Annual Report filed on Form 10-K for a more
detailed discussion of quantitative and qualitative disclosures about market
risk. Except as discussed above, our market risk disclosures have not changed
significantly from the 1999 Annual Report on Form 10-K.</font></p>
<p align="center"><font size="2">25</font></p>
<hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">

  <a name="page_26"></a>
  <p align="center"><b><font size="2"><a name=OI></A>PART II &#151; OTHER INFORMATION</font></b></p>
  <p><b><font size="2"><a name=LP></A>Item 1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Legal Proceedings</font></b></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">On August 10, 2000, Adobe
  filed suit in the U.S. District Court of Delaware against Macromedia, Inc.
  (&#147;Macromedia&#148;) for infringement of U.S. Patent No. 5,546,528 related to
  Adobe's tabbed palette patent, which is Adobe's method of displaying and
  working with multiple sets of information in the same area of the computer
  screen. On September 18, 2000, Adobe amended its complaint to include an
  additional claim of infringement of U.S. Patent No. 6,084,597 related to a
  method of rasterizing and rendering complex layered compositions in a movie.
  The complaint seeks a permanent injunction and unspecified treble damages.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">On September 27, 2000,
  Macromedia filed counterclaims in the U.S. District Court of Delaware for
  infringement of U.S. Patent No. 5,467,443, which relates to changing blended
  elements and automatic re-blending of elements, and U.S. Patent Nos. 5,151,998
  and 5,204,969, which relate to visually displaying and editing sound
  waveforms. Macromedia denied it infringes Adobe's patents in its answer to
  Adobe's amended complaint. The counterclaim seeks a declaration that
  Adobe's patents are unenforceable, invalid, and not infringed by Macromedia,
  a permanent injunction, and unspecified treble damages.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">On February 6, 1996, a
  securities class action complaint was filed against Adobe, certain of its
  officers and directors, certain former officers of Adobe and Frame Technology
  Corporation (&#147;Frame&#148;), Hambrecht &amp; Quist, LLP (&#147;H&amp;Q&#148;),
  investment banker for Frame, and certain H&amp;Q employees, in connection with
  the drop in the price of Adobe stock following its announcement of financial
  results for the quarter ended December 1, 1995. The complaint was filed in the
  Superior Court of the State of California, County of Santa Clara. The
  complaint alleges that the defendants misrepresented material adverse
  information regarding Adobe and Frame and engaged in a scheme to defraud
  investors. The complaint seeks unspecified damages for alleged violations of
  California law. The court granted plaintiffs' motion for class certification
  on September 22, 1999. We believe that the allegations against us and our
  officers and directors are without merit and intend to vigorously defend the
  lawsuit. The case is currently in the discovery phase.</font></p>
  <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font size="2">Management believes that the
  ultimate resolution of these matters will not have a material impact on our
  financial position or results of operations.</font></p>
  <p align="center"><font size="2">26</font></p>
  <hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">

<A name="page_1"></A>

<P align="right">
<font size="2">Exhibit 10.65</font>
</P>

<P>
<font size="2">
<IMG src="ex10-65x1x1.jpg">
</font>
</P>
<table border="0" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
  <tr>
    <td width="40%">
<FONT size=2>AMENDMENT TO THE January 28, 2000&nbsp; </FONT>
    </td>
    <td width="60%">
<FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Revised : Aug. 15, 2000 </FONT>
    </td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td width="40%">
<FONT size=2> ADOBE EUROPE &#147;DIRECT&#148; AGREEMENT </FONT>
    </td>
    <td width="60%">
<P>
<FONT size=2>(Original Sent : May 31, 2000) </FONT>
</P>
    </td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<P>
<FONT size=2>This Amendment to the Adobe Europe &#147;Direct&#148; Agreement (&#147;Agreement&#148;) is<br>
&nbsp;between Adobe Systems Benelux B.V., a company incorporated in The Netherlands<br>
&nbsp;and having a place of business at Europlaza, Hoogoorddreef 54a, 1101 BE<br>
Amsterdam ZO, The Netherlands (&#147;Adobe&#148;), and Sykes Europe Limited, a company<br>
&nbsp;incorporated in Scotland under the Companies Act with registered number and&nbsp;<br>
 having its registered office at Nether Road, Galashiels, Selkirkshire, TD1 3HE&nbsp;<br>
 (hereinafter called &#147;Sykes&#148;). This replaces an original set sent via E-Mail on<br>
&nbsp;May 31, 2000, which cannot be traced; and adds Item 3, Expansion of Countries for<br>
&nbsp;Adobe Direct. </FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT size=2>Adobe and Vendor agree as follows: </FONT>
</P>
<TABLE width="100%" border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0>
<TR>
   <TD width="5%"></TD>
   <TD width="5%"><FONT size=2>1.</FONT></TD>
   <TD width="90%"><FONT size=2>Attachment 1. Adendum to Statement of Work encompassing Outbound Services,
    Version 1.1, Dated March 2000.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
   <TD width="5%"></TD>
   <TD width="5%"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></TD>
   <TD width="90%"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></TD>
</TR>

   <TD width="5%"></TD>
   <TD width="5%"><FONT size=2>2.</FONT></TD>

   <TD width="90%"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></TD>

<font size="2">

EXPANSION OF COUNTRIES</B></font>

<P align="center">

<table border="0" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"><font size="2"><B>1.</B></font></td>
    <td width="96%" colspan="2"><font size="2"><B>Additional countries</B></font></td>

    </td>

      note: English is not widely used in Portugal. We recommend that Portugese is included in
      the language cover<B>.</B></font></td>

2</font>
</P>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=2>


<A name="page_8"></A>

<P>
<font size="2"><b>Executive Summary</b></font>
</P>
<hr align="left" noshade size="1">
<P>
<FONT size=2>This document describes the processes and environment under which Sykes will provide outbound telemarketing services to Adobe for Anti-Piracy campaigns and will also allow for the extension of existing order management services to include
regular outbound sales programs. The Statement of Work (SOW) should be seen as a live document and updated as and when necessary. </FONT>
</P>
<P><font size="2">
<B>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </B><B>Account Management </B>
</font>
</P>
<P>
<FONT size=2>Overall responsibility for the performance and management of the Outbound services lies with the Client Group Manager (CGM). The CGM reports to the Call Centre Director who in turn reports to the Regional Director of Call Centre Services
(CCS). </FONT>
</P>
<P>
<B><font size="2">1.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Account Management Structure &amp; Responsibilities</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
The Sykes organisational structure consists of a core management team dedicated to Adobe programmes with responsibility for delivering all aspects of a clients business, whether it is implementation of a project or discussing a new service. The Account
or Project owner sit in the centre of the circle and call on the skills, knowledge and expertise of specialist functions within the organisation. These specialist functions would be from
Telecommunications, MIS, Finance, Legal or Distribution.</font>
</P>
<P>
<B><font size="2">1.1.1&nbsp; Client Group Manager</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
The CGM is responsible for the Client Group 1 overall performance and profitability.</font>
</P>
<P>
<B><I><font size="2">Key Objectives</font></I></B>
</P>
<UL>
<LI><font size="2">Manage the relationship with Adobe and ensure satisfaction of outbound services delivered by Sykes.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Manage the relationship with other teams, functions and BU&#146;s within the Sykes organisation.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Motivate and manage a core group of individuals to meet the KPI&#146;s and business objectives of the outbound campaigns.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Work with Business Manager to prepare pricing and new initiative for Outbound programmes.</font></LI>
</UL>
<p align="center"><font size="2">3</font></p>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=2>


<A name="page_9"></A>

<P>
<B><font size="2">1.1.2&nbsp; Program Manager</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<B><I><font size="2">Key Objectives</font> </I></B>
</P>
<UL>
<LI><font size="2">Co-ordinate all Outbound communication and feedback.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Provide project management within the team regarding implementation for extended or new business.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Provide the interface between Adobe Order Management and all aspects of Sykes&#146; business.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Prepare pricing for extension to existing services<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Process management ownership.<BR></font></LI>
</UL>
<P>
<B><font size="2">1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Core Operational Team</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
The outbound programmes will initially be run from within the existing pool of Direct sales agents until such time as the of outbound calls/number of programme initiatives increases to an extent to allow for a dedicated resource to be applied.</font>
</P>
<P>
<B><font size="2">1.2.1&nbsp; Senior Supervisor</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<B><I><font size="2">Key Objectives</font></I></B>
</P>
<UL>
<LI><font size="2">Ensure Team Lead and agents are aware of KPI&#146;s.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Monitor call performance and instigate corrective action to improve performance.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Propose process improvements.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Ensure ongoing training requirements are met.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Carry out recruitment selection of agents with Team Lead assistance.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Ensure processes are understood and adhered to.<BR></font></LI>
</UL>
<P>
<B><font size="2">1.2.2&nbsp; Team Lead</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<B><I><font size="2">Key Objectives</font> </I></B>
</P>
<UL>
<LI><font size="2">Work with Senior Supervisor, program Manager and Agents to ensure individual performance to provide the highest service quality<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Communicate policies and processes to agents.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Manage team call monitoring process.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Assist in team recruitment selection.<BR></font></LI>
</UL>
<P align="center">
<font size="2">
4&nbsp;</font>
</P>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=2>


<A name="page_10"></A>

<P>
<B><font size="2">1.2.3&nbsp; Agent</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<B><I><font size="2">Key Objectives</font></I></B>
</P>
<UL>
<LI><font size="2">To provide a professional and efficient outbound service function on behalf of Adobe.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Handling of transactions for the outbound campaigns to the required KPI&#146;s.<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Ensuring customers are aware of appropriate services and programs on offer.<BR></font></LI>
</UL>
<P><font size="2">
<B>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </B><B>Outbound Project Criteria </B>
</font>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
The following sub-heading give details of the call centre criteria required for outbound campaigns &#150; any campaigns requiring specific process changes will result in an amendment to this SOW. All customer contact is logged in Siebel and a full
customer history maintained.</font>
</P>
<P>
<B><font size="2">2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Call Targets</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
Adobe will provide Sykes with all call target listings. Sykes understands that these will be generated either from a local Adobe office or from the central database managed by Sykes within Calder House, Edinburgh.</font>
</P>
<P>
<FONT size=2>Call target files should be submitted to Sykes in agreed format for each project to allow use of any predictive dialing tools which may become necessary. </FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT size=2>The call target files should have as a minimum the following information: </FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<LI><font size="2">name<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">title<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">address<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">phone number<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Adobe CSN (where applicable)<BR></font></LI>
</UL>
<P>
<FONT size=2>It is understood that as the outbound services develop that further criteria can be added. </FONT>
</P>
<P align="center">
<font size="2">
5&nbsp;</font>
</P>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=2>


<A name="page_11"></A>

<P>
<B><font size="2">2.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Call Scripting</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
Adobe will provide Sykes with approved, and where necessary localised, call scripts for the outbound campaigns. Sykes understands that specific scripts will be developed for individual campaigns and that call testing may be required to determine the call
lengths and suitability.</font>
</P>
<P>
<B><font size="2">2.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Agent Training</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
Structured training will be a requirement for all outbound campaigns. The training shall encompass:</font>
</P>
<UL>
<LI><font size="2">Call script training<BR></font></LI>
<LI><font size="2">Campaign training<BR></font></LI>
</UL>
<P>
<FONT size=2>This training should be delivered by the appropriate Adobe resource sponsoring the campaign. </FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT size=2>Sykes will provide all call centre, systems, process and telemarketing training necessary for outbound projects. </FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT size=2>All training programmes will be scheduled with the Sykes Senior Supervisor. </FONT>
</P>
<P><font size="2">
<B>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </B><B>Outbound Sales Order Processing </B>
</font>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
Sykes understands that for outbound campaigns there will be 2 main goals:</font>
</P>
<TABLE width="100%" border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0>
<TR>
   <TD width="4%"><FONT size=2>1)</FONT></TD>
   <TD width="96%"><b><font size="2">[&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ]</font></b></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
   <TD width="4%"><FONT size=2>2)</FONT></TD>
   <TD width="96%"><b><font size="2">[&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ]</font></b></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE><P>
<B><font size="2">3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Customer Profiling</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">All profiling information gathered during an outbound call will be entered into the Seibel database as managed by Sykes. This will encompass:</font>
</P>
<P>
<FONT size=2>1.</FONT><B><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></B><FONT size=2> updating an existing customer record with new data received </FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT size=2>2.&nbsp;</FONT><B><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></B><FONT size=2>generating new customer records for customers not already present in the database </FONT>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;</font><font size="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>Confidential Treatment Requested&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>
</P>
<P align="center">
<font size="2">
6&nbsp;</font>
</P>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=2>


<A name="page_12"></A>

<P>
<B><font size="2">3.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Revenue Generation</font></B>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
A key element of all <B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ] </B>will be revenue generation through <B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ].</B></font>
</P>
<ul>
  <li><font size="2">All sales will be processed as per the existing Sales Order Process detailed within the Order Management SOW. Existing KPI agreements will be adhered to unless otherwise agreed with Adobe.<BR></font></li>
  <li><font size="2">All product fulfillments resulting from the sale function will be fulfilled from
    <B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ] </B>through the normal Direct Sales Order Fulfillment process as detailed in the Order Management SOW. Existing Fulfillment KPI agreements will be adhered to unless otherwise agreed with Adobe.</font></li>
</ul>
<P>
<font size="2">All sales resulting from <B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ] </B>will be tagged, tracked and reported via
<B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ] </B>assigned to each project.</font>
</P>
<P><font size="2">
<B>4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </B><B>Reporting </B>
</font>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
Sykes will be able to provide Adobe with the following reporting metrics:</font>
</P>
<ul>
  <li><font size="2"><B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ]</B></font><font size="2"><B> </B>including
    </font><font size="2"><B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ]</B></font></li>
  <li><font size="2"><B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ]</B></font></li>
  <li><font size="2"><B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ]</B></font></li>
  <li><font size="2"><B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ]</B></font></li>
  <li><font size="2"><B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ]</B></font></li>
</ul>
<P><font size="2">
<B>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </B><B>Pricing </B>
</font>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
Pricing for out-bound services is detailed in the Pricing schedules attached to this statement of work.</font>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">Sykes agree that the pricing for outbound will be reviewed after <B>[&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp; ].</B></font>
</P>
<P>
<font size="2">
<B>*</B>&nbsp;<B>Confidential Treatment Requested</B></font>
</P>
<P align="center">
<font size="2">
7&nbsp;</font>
</P>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=2>

<p align="right"><b><font size="2">Exhibit 10.66</font></b></p>

<hr noshade size="4">
<hr noshade>

<P align="center">
<B><FONT size=5>CREDIT AGREEMENT </FONT></B>
</P>

<P align="center">
<B><FONT size=4>among </FONT></B>
</P>
<P align="center">
<B><FONT size=5>ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED </FONT></B>
</P>
<P align="center">
<B><FONT size=4>and </FONT></B>
</P>
<P align="center">
<B><FONT size=5>LENDERS NAMED HEREIN </FONT></B>
</P>
<P align="center">
<B><FONT size=4>and </FONT></B>
</P>
<P align="center"><B><FONT size=5>ABN AMRO BANK N.V.,<br>
 </FONT><FONT size=4>as Administrative Agent for Lenders </FONT></B>
</P>
<P align="center"><B><FONT size=4>(364-Day Revolving Credit/Term Loan Facility) </FONT></B>
</P>
<P align="center">
<B><FONT size=4>August 9, 2000 </FONT></B>
</P>
<hr noshade>
<hr noshade size="4">
<P>
&nbsp;
</P>

   <TD width="17" height="25" bgcolor="#EAF9E8">&nbsp;</TD>
   <TD height="25" bgcolor="#EAF9E8"><font size="2">Interest</font></TD>
   <TD width="29" align="right" height="25" bgcolor="#EAF9E8"><font size="2">24</font></TD>
   <TD width="10" height="25" bgcolor="#EAF9E8">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
   <TD width="95" align="right" height="25"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.05.</font></TD>
   <TD width="17" height="25"><font size="2">&nbsp;</font></TD>

<font size="2">

any pages following the Table of Contents/Authorities.</font>

<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size=2>





<p align="center"><b><u><font size="2">CREDIT AGREEMENT</font></u></b></p>
<p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS
CREDIT AGREEMENT, dated as of August 9, 2000, is entered into by and among:</font></p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;
      ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED, a Delaware corporation (&#147;<u>Borrower</u>&#148;);</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;
      Each of the financial institutions from time to time listed in <u>Schedule
      </u>I hereto, as amended from time to time (such financial institutions to
      be referred to herein collectively as <u>&#147;Lenders</u>&#148;); and</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;
      ABN AMRO BANK N.V., as agent for Lenders (in such capacity, <u>&#147;Administrative
      Agent</u>&#148;).</font></p>
    </td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<p align="center"><b><u><font size="2">RECITALS</font></u></b></p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="95%">
  <tr>
    <td width="8%"></td>
    <td width="92%"><font size="2">A.&nbsp; Borrower has requested Lenders to
      provide certain credit facilities to Borrower.</font>
      <p><font size="2">B.&nbsp; Lenders are willing to provide such credit
      facilities upon the terms and subject to the conditions set forth herein.</font></p>
    </td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<p align="center"><b><u><font size="2">AGREEMENT</font></u></b></p>
<p align="left"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, in consideration of the above Recitals and the mutual covenants
herein contained, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows:</font></p>
<p><font size="2"><b>SECTION I.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<u>INTERPRETATION</u></b>.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.01.&nbsp;
<u>Definitions</u>. Unless otherwise indicated in this Agreement or any other
Credit Document, each term set forth below, when used in this Agreement or any
other Credit Document, shall have the respective meaning given to that term
below or in the provision of this Agreement or other document, instrument or
agreement referenced below.</font></p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>ABN
      AMRO</u>&#148; shall mean ABN AMRO Bank N.V.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Administrative
      Agent</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>clause (3) of
      the introductory paragraph </u>hereof.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Administrative
      Agent&#146;s Fee Letter</u>&#148; shall mean the letter agreement dated as of
      August 9, 2000, between Borrower and Administrative Agent regarding
      certain fees payable by Borrower to Administrative Agent.</font></p>
    </td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<p align="center"><font size="2">1</font></p>
<hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">




<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Adobe
      Incentive Partners</u>&#148; shall mean Adobe Incentive Partners, L.P., a
      California limited partnership, in which Borrower is the general partner
      and all of the limited partners are Borrower or Affiliates of Borrower.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Adobe
      Incentive Partners Distributions</u>&#148; shall mean distributions of cash
      or securities owned by Adobe Incentive Partners, repurchases of unvested
      partnership interests in Adobe Incentive Partners, and issuances of
      partnership interests in Adobe Incentive Partners.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Affiliate</u>&#148;
      shall mean, with respect to any Person, (a) each Person that, directly or
      indirectly, owns or controls, whether beneficially or as a trustee,
      guardian or other fiduciary, ten percent (10%) or more of any class of
      Equity Securities of such Person, (b) each Person that controls, is
      controlled by or is under common control with such Person or any Affiliate
      of such Person or (c) each of such Person&#146;s officers, directors, general
      partners and, if such Person is a joint venture organized as a separate
      legal entity, joint venturers having powers comparable to a general
      partner; <u>provided</u>, <u>however,</u> that in no case shall any of the
      following Persons be deemed to be an Affiliate of Borrower or any of its
      Subsidiaries for purposes of this Agreement: (i) Administrative Agent or
      any Lender or (ii) the general partner of any VC Partnership which would
      otherwise be deemed an Affiliate solely because it acts as general partner
      and controls such VC Partnership. For the purpose of this definition, &#147;control&#148;
      of a Person shall mean the possession, directly or indirectly, of the
      power to direct or cause the direction of its management or policies.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Agreement</u>&#148;
      shall mean this Credit Agreement.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Applicable
      Lending Office</u>&#148; shall mean, with respect to any Lender, (a) in the
      case of its Base Rate Loans and Base Rate Portions, its Domestic Lending
      Office, and (b) in the case of its LIBOR Loans and LIBOR Portions, its
      Euro-Dollar Lending Office. <u>&#147;Applicable Margin</u>&#148; shall mean,
      with respect to any Loan or Portion at any time, the <i>per annum</i>
      margin which is determined pursuant to the Pricing Grid and added to the
      Base Rate or LIBO Rate, as the case may be, for such Loan or Portion; <u>provided</u>,
      <u>however</u>, that each Applicable Margin determined pursuant to the
      Pricing Grid shall be increased by two percent (2.00%) <i>per annum</i> on
      the date an Event of Default occurs and shall continue at such increased
      rate unless and until such Event of Default is waived or cured in
      accordance with this Agreement. The Applicable Margins shall be determined
      as provided in the Pricing Grid and may change for each Pricing Period.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Assignee
      Lender</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph</u>
      <u>8.05(c)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Assignment</u>&#148;
      shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph 8.05(c)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<u>&#147;Assignment
      Agreement</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph
      8.05(c)</u>.</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<p align="center"><font size="2">2</font></p>
<hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">


<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%">
    <td width="96%"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Assignment
      Effective Date</u>&#148; shall have, with respect to each Assignment
      Agreement, the meaning set forth therein.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Assignor
      Lender</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph</u>
      <u>8.05(c)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Base
      Rate</u>&#148; shall mean, on any day, the greater of (a) the Prime Rate in
      effect on such date and (b) the Federal Funds Rate for such day <u>plus</u>
      one-half percent (0.50%).</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Base
      Rate Loan</u>&#148; shall mean, at any time, a Revolving Loan which then
      bears interest as provided in <u>clause (i) of Subparagraph 2.04(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Base
      Rate Portion</u>&#148; shall mean, at any time, a Portion of the Term Loan
      Borrowing or a Term Loan, as the case may be, which then bears interest as
      provided in <u>clause (i) of Subparagraph 2.04(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Borrower</u>&#148;
      shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>clause (1) of the
      introductory paragraph</u> hereof.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Borrowing</u>&#148;
      shall mean a Revolving Loan Borrowing or the Term Loan Borrowing.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Business
      Day</u>&#148; shall mean any day on which (a) commercial banks are not
      authorized or required to close in San Francisco, California, New York,
      New York or Chicago, Illinois, and (b) if such Business Day is related to
      a LIBOR Loan or a LIBOR Portion, dealings in Dollar deposits are carried
      out in the London interbank market.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Capital
      Adequacy Requirement</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph
      2.13(d)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Capital
      Asset</u>&#148; shall mean, with respect to any Person, any tangible fixed or
      capital asset owned or leased (in the case of a Capital Lease) by such
      Person, or any expense incurred by such Person that is required by GAAP to
      be reported as a non-current asset on such Person&#146;s balance sheet.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Capital
      Leases</u>&#148; shall mean any and all lease obligations that, in accordance
      with GAAP, are required to be capitalized on the books of a lessee.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Change
      of Control</u>&#148; shall mean</font></p>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="8%"></td>
    <td width="92%"><font size="2"><br>
      &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) With
      respect to Borrower, (i) the acquisition after the date hereof by any
      person or group of persons (within the meaning of Section 13 or 14 of the
      Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (as amended, the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;)) of
      (A) beneficial ownership (within the meaning of Rule 13d-3 promulgated by
      the Securities and Exchange Commission under the Exchange Act) of fifty
      percent (50%) or more of the outstanding Equity Securities of Borrower
      entitled to vote for members of the board of directors, or (B) all or
      substantially all of the assets of</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<p align="center"><font size="2">3</font></p>
<hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">



<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="8%"></td>
    <td width="92%"><font size="2">Borrower; or (ii) during any period of twelve
      (12) consecutive calendar months, individuals who are directors of
      Borrower on the first day of such period (&#147;Initial Directors&#148;) and any
      directors of Borrower who are specifically approved by two-thirds of the
      Initial Directors and previously-approved Directors shall cease to
      constitute a majority of the Board of Directors of Borrower before the end
      of such period; or</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)
      With respect to any Material Subsidiary, Borrower shall cease to own,
      directly or indirectly, one hundred percent (100%) of the Equity
      Securities of such Subsidiary except for nominal amounts of stock
      necessary to do business in certain jurisdictions outside the United
      States.</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="92%"><font size="2"><br>
      &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Change
      of Law</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph</u>
      <u>2.13(b)</u>.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Commitment
      Effective Date</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph
      2.06(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Commitment
      Fee Percentage</u>&#148; shall mean, at any time, the <i>per annum</i>
      percentage which is used to calculate Commitment Fees. The Commitment Fee
      Percentages shall be determined as provided in the Pricing Grid and may
      change for each Pricing Period.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Commitment
      Fees</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph</u>
      <u>2.07(b)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Commitment</u>&#148;
      shall mean, with respect to each Lender, the Dollar amount set forth under
      the caption &#147;Commitment&#148; opposite such Lender&#146;s name on <u>Part A of
      Schedule </u>I, or, if changed, such Dollar amount as may be set forth for
      such Lender in the Register.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Compliance
      Certificate</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph
      5.01(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Consent
      to Increase Commitment</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in
      <u>Subparagraph 2.06(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Contingent
      Obligation</u>&#148; shall mean, with respect to any Person, (a) any Guaranty
      Obligation of that Person; and (b) any direct or indirect obligation or
      liability, contingent or otherwise, of that Person (i) in respect of any
      Surety Instrument issued for the account of that Person or as to which
      that Person is otherwise liable for reimbursement of drawings or payments,
      (ii) as a partner or joint venturer in any partnership or joint venture,
      (iii) to purchase any materials, supplies or other property from, or to
      obtain the services of, another Person if the relevant contract or other
      related document or obligation requires that payment for such materials,
      supplies or other property, or for such services, shall be made regardless
      of whether delivery of such materials, supplies or other property is ever
      made or tendered, or such services are ever performed or tendered, (iv) in
      respect to any Rate Contract that is not entered into in connection with a
      bona fide hedging</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<p align="center"><font size="2">4</font></p>
<hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">



<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2">operation that provides offsetting benefits
      to such Person, or (v) to purchase or sell Equity Securities or other
      securities of any Person. The amount of any Contingent Obligation shall
      (subject, in the case of Guaranty Obligations, to the last sentence of the
      definition of &#147;Guaranty Obligation&#148;) be deemed equal to the maximum
      reasonably anticipated liability in respect thereof; <u>provided</u>, that
      (A) in the case of <u>item (b)(v)</u> of this definition, the amount of
      the Contingent Obligation with respect to the purchase or sale of such
      Equity Securities or other securities shall be the net settlement amount
      to be paid in cash or securities, and (B) in the case of <u>item (b)(iv)</u>
      of this definition, the Contingent Obligation with respect to such Rate
      Contracts shall be marked to market on a current basis.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Contractual
      Obligation</u>&#148; of any Person shall mean, any indenture, note, lease,
      loan agreement, security, deed of trust, mortgage, security agreement,
      guaranty, instrument, contract, agreement or other form of contractual
      obligation or undertaking to which such Person is a party or by which such
      Person or any of its property is bound.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Credit
      Documents</u>&#148; shall mean and include this Agreement, the Notes and the
      Administrative Agent&#146;s Fee Letter; all other documents, instruments and
      agreements delivered to Administrative Agent or any Lender pursuant to <u>Paragraph
      3.01</u>; and all other documents, instruments and agreements pursuant to
      the terms of this Agreement required to be delivered by Borrower or any of
      its Subsidiaries to Administrative Agent or any Lender in connection with
      this Agreement on or after the date of this Agreement.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Credit
      Event</u>&#148; shall mean the making of any Loan (other than the making of a
      Base Rate Loan solely to repay an existing Loan); the conversion of any
      Portion into a LIBOR Portion; or the selection of a new Interest Period
      for any LIBOR Loan or LIBOR Portion.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Debt/EBITDA
      Ratio</u>&#148; shall mean, with respect to Borrower for any consecutive
      four-quarter period, the ratio, determined on a consolidated basis in
      accordance with GAAP, of:</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>

    <td width="8%"></td>

      Indebtedness of Borrower and its Subsidiaries on the last day of such
      period, excluding any Indebtedness under or with respect to currency
      exchange Rate Contracts;</font>
      <p align="center"><u><font size="2">to</font></u></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)
      The EBITDA of Borrower and its Subsidiaries for such period.</font></td>

      shall mean an Event of Default or any event or circumstance not yet
      constituting an Event of Default which, with the giving of any notice or
      the lapse of any period of time or both, would become an Event of Default.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Defaulting
      Lender</u>&#148; shall mean a Lender which has failed to fund its portion of
      any Borrowing which it is required to fund under this Agreement and has
      continued in such failure for five (5) Business Days.</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>

      (including any such successor publication, the &#147;Composite 3:30 p.m.
      Quotations&#148;) for such day under the caption &#147;Federal Funds Effective
      Rate&#148;. If on any relevant day, such rate is not yet published in either
      H.15 (519) or the Composite 3:30 p.m. Quotations, the rate for such day
      shall be the arithmetic mean, as determined by Administrative Agent, of
      the rates quoted to Administrative Agent for such day by three</font></td>

      consolidated balance sheet of Borrower and its Subsidiaries on the last
      day of such period, <u>plus</u> without duplication, (iv) twenty percent
      (20%) of all off-balance sheet Indebtedness of Borrower and its
      Subsidiaries on the last day of such period; <u>provided</u>, <u>however,</u>
      that any Indebtedness under or with respect to currency exchange Rate
      Contracts shall be excluded for purposes of the calculation under this <u>subparagraph

    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>GAAP&#148;
      </u>shall mean generally accepted accounting principles and practices as
      in effect in the United States of America from time to time, consistently
      applied.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Governmental
      Authority</u>&#148; shall mean any domestic or foreign national, state or
      local government, any political subdivision thereof, any department,
      agency, authority or bureau of any of the foregoing, or any other entity
      exercising executive, legislative, judicial, regulatory or administrative
      functions of or pertaining to government, including, without limitation,
      the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the Federal Reserve Board, the
      Comptroller of the Currency, any central bank or any comparable authority.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Governmental
      Charges</u>&#148; shall mean, with respect to any Person, all levies,
      assessments, fees, claims or other charges imposed by any Governmental
      Authority upon such Person or any of its property or otherwise payable by
      such Person.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Governmental
      Rule</u>&#148; shall mean any law, rule, regulation, ordinance, order, code
      interpretation, judgment, decree, directive, guidelines, policy or similar
      form of decision of any Governmental Authority which is made publicly
      available.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Granting
      Lender</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph</u>
      <u>8.05(d)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Guaranty
      Obligation</u>&#148; shall mean, with respect to any Person, any direct or
      indirect liability of that Person with respect to any indebtedness, lease,
      dividend, letter of credit or other obligation (the &#147;primary obligations&#148;)
      of another Person (the &#147;primary obligor&#148;), including any obligation of
      that Person, whether or not contingent, (a) to purchase, repurchase or
      otherwise acquire such primary obligations or any property constituting
      direct or indirect security therefor, or (b) to advance or provide funds (i)
      for the payment or discharge of any such primary obligation, or (ii) to
      maintain working capital or equity capital of the primary obligor or
      otherwise to maintain the net worth or solvency or any balance sheet item,
      level of income or financial condition of the primary obligor, or (c) to
      purchase property, securities or services primarily for the purpose of
      assuring the owner of any such primary obligation of the ability of the
      primary obligor to make payment of such primary obligation, or (d)
      otherwise to assure or hold harmless the holder of any such primary
      obligation against loss in respect thereof. The amount of any Guaranty
      Obligation shall be deemed equal to the stated or determinable amount of
      the primary obligation in respect of which such Guaranty Obligation is
      made or, if not stated or if indeterminable, the maximum reasonably
      anticipated liability in respect thereof.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Hazardous
      Materials</u>&#148; shall mean all pollutants, contaminants and other
      materials, substances and wastes which are hazardous, toxic, caustic,
      harmful or dangerous to human health or the environment, including
      petroleum and petroleum products and byproducts, radioactive materials,
      asbestos, polychlorinated biphenyls and all materials, substances and
      wastes which are classified or regulated as &#147;hazardous,&#148; &#147;toxic&#148;
      or similar descriptions under any Environmental Law.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Indebtedness</u>&#148;
      of any Person shall mean, without duplication:</font></td>

      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)

      - (f)</u> above to the extent secured by (or for which any holder of such
      obligations has an existing right, contingent or otherwise, to be secured
      by) any Lien in any property (including accounts and contract rights) of
      such Person, even though such Person has not assumed or become liable for
      the payment of such obligations.</font></td>

      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Interest

      the time period selected by Borrower pursuant to <u>Subparagraph 2.01(b),
      Subparagraph 2.03(b) or Subparagraph 2.04(c)</u> which commences on the

<p align="center"><font size="2">10</font></p>
<hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">


<a name="page_11"></a>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2"><u>Subparagraph 2.04(b)</u> which commences
      on the last day of the immediately preceding time period and ends on the
      last day of that time period.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Investment</u>&#148;
      of any Person shall mean any loan or advance of funds by such Person to
      any other Person (other than advances to employees of such Person for
      moving and travel expenses, drawing accounts and similar expenditures in
      the ordinary course of business), any purchase or other acquisition of any
      Equity Securities or Indebtedness of any other Person, any capital
      contribution by such Person to or any other investment by such Person in
      any other Person (including any Guaranty Obligations of such Person and
      any indebtedness of such Person of the type described in <u>clause (h)</u>
      of the definition of &#147;Indebtedness&#148; on behalf of any other Person); <u>provided</u>,
      <u>however,</u> that Investments shall not include (a) accounts receivable
      or other indebtedness owed by customers of such Person which are current
      assets and arose from sales of inventory in the ordinary course of such
      Person&#146;s business, (b) prepaid expenses of such Person incurred and
      prepaid in the ordinary course of business, or (c) acquisitions of Equity
      Securities subject to <u>Subparagraph 5.02(d)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>IRC</u>&#148;
      shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Lenders</u>&#148;
      shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>clause (2) of the
      introductory paragraph</u> hereof.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>LIBO
      Rate</u>&#148; shall mean, with respect to any Interest Period for the LIBOR
      Loans in any Revolving Loan Borrowing consisting of LIBOR Loans or any
      LIBOR Portion of the Term Loan Borrowing, a rate <i>per annum</i> equal to
      the quotient (rounded upward if necessary to the nearest 1/100 of one
      percent) of:</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="8%"></td>
    <td width="92%"><font size="2"><br>
      &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) As elected
      by Borrower, either:</font></td>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="12%"></td>
    <td width="88%"><font size="2"><br>
      &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) The
      arithmetic mean (rounded upward if necessary to the nearest 1/16 of one
      percent) of the rates <i>per annum</i> appearing on Telerate Page 3750 (or
      any successor publication) on the second Business Day prior to the first
      day of such Interest Period at or about 11:00 A.M. (London time) (for
      delivery on the first day of such Interest Period) for a term comparable
      to such Interest Period (the <u>&#147;Telerate Page Rate</u>&#148;); or</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)
      The arithmetic mean (rounded upward if necessary to the nearest 1/16 of
      one percent) of the rates <i>per annum</i> at which Dollar deposits are
      offered to each of the Reference Banks in the London interbank market on
      the second Business Day prior to the first day of such Interest Period at
      or about 11:00 A.M. (London time) (for delivery on the first day of such
      Interest Period) in an amount substantially equal to such Reference Bank&#146;s
      LIBOR Loan or LIBOR Portion in such Borrowing and for a term comparable to
      such Interest Period (the <u>&#147;Reference Bank Rate</u>&#148;);</font></p>
    </td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>

    <td width="92%">
      <p align="center"><u><font size="2">divided by</font></u></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)
      One minus the Reserve Requirement for such Loans or Portion in effect from
      time to time.</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2"><br>
      If, for any reason, any Reference Banks do not provide Administrative
      Agent with rates pursuant to <u>clause (a)(ii)</u> after Borrower elects
      the Reference Bank Rate to determine the LIBO Rate for any Interest
      Period, Administrative Agent shall calculate the Reference Bank Rate for
      such Interest Period based upon the rate or rates provided by the other
      Reference Banks or Reference Bank; <u>provided</u>, <u>however,</u> that,
      if no Reference Bank provides Administrative Agent with such a rate,
      Administrative Agent shall determine the LIBO Rate for such Interest
      Period based upon the Telerate Page Rate. If, for any reason, the Telerate
      Page Rate is not available after Borrower elects the Telerate Page Rate to
      determine the LIBO Rate for any Interest Period, Administrative Agent
      shall determine the LIBO Rate for such Interest Period based upon the
      Reference Bank Rate. The LIBO Rate shall be adjusted automatically as to
      all LIBOR Loans and LIBOR Portions then outstanding as of the effective
      date of any change in the Reserve Requirement.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>LIBOR
      Loan</u>&#148; shall mean, at any time, a Revolving Loan which then bears
      interest as provided in <u>clause (ii) of Subparagraph 2.04(a)</u>. <u>&#147;LIBOR
      Portion</u>&#148; shall mean, at any time, a Portion of the Term Loan
      Borrowing or a Term Loan, as the case may be, which then bears interest as
      provided in <u>clause (ii) of</u> <u>Subparagraph 2.04(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Lien</u>&#148;
      shall mean, with respect to any property, any security interest, mortgage,
      pledge, lien, charge or other encumbrance in, of, or on such property or
      the income therefrom, including, without limitation, the interest of a
      vendor or lessor under a conditional sale agreement, Capital Lease or
      other title retention agreement, or any agreement to provide any of the
      foregoing, and the filing of any financing statement or similar instrument
      under the Uniform Commercial Code or comparable law of any jurisdiction
      other than filings made for notice purposes only in connection with true
      leases (which would not include &#147;synthetic&#148; leases).</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Loan</u>&#148;
      shall mean a Revolving Loan or a Term Loan.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Loan
      Account</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph</u>
      <u>2.10(a)</u>.</font></p>

      at any time any Lender is a Defaulting Lender, the &#147;Proportionate Shares&#148;

      directly related to such sale or issuance that are to be paid by such
      Person.</font></p>

      the day following the last day of the immediately preceding three-calendar

      AMRO from time to time at its Chicago Office. The Prime Rate is determined
      by ABN AMRO from time to time as a means of pricing credit extensions to
      some customers and is neither directly tied to any external rate of
      interest or index nor necessarily the lowest rate of interest charged by
      ABN AMRO at any given time for any particular class of customers or credit
      extensions. Any change in the Base Rate resulting from a change in the
      Prime Rate shall become effective on the Business Day on which each change
      in the Prime Rate occurs.</font></p>

<a name="page_17"></a>

  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2"><br>
      Lenders whose Proportionate Shares as so determined then equal or exceed
      sixty-six and two-thirds percent (66 2/3%).)</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Requirement
      of Law</u>&#148; applicable to any Person shall mean (a) the Articles or
      Certificate of Incorporation and By-laws, Partnership Agreement or other
      organizational or governing documents of such Person, (b) any Governmental
      Rule applicable to such Person, (c) any license, permit, approval or other
      authorization granted by any Governmental Authority to or for the benefit
      of such Person or (d) any judgment, decision or determination of any
      Governmental Authority or arbitrator, in each case applicable to or
      binding upon such Person or any of its property or to which such Person or
      any of its property is subject.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Reserve
      Requirement</u>&#148; shall mean, with respect to any day in an Interest
      Period for a LIBOR Loan or LIBOR Portion, the aggregate of the reserve
      requirement rates (expressed as a decimal) in effect on such day for
      eurocurrency funding (currently referred to as &#147;Eurocurrency liabilities&#148;
      in Regulation D of the Federal Reserve Board) maintained by a member bank
      of the Federal Reserve System. As used herein, the term &#147;reserve
      requirement&#148; shall include, without limitation, any basic, supplemental
      or emergency reserve requirements imposed on any Lender by any
      Governmental Authority. <u>&#147;Revolving Loan</u>&#148; shall have the meaning
      given to that term in <u>Subparagraph 2.01(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Revolving
      Loan Borrowing</u>&#148; shall mean a borrowing by Borrower consisting of the
      Revolving Loans made by each of the Lenders on the same date and of the
      same Type pursuant to a single Notice of Revolving Loan Borrowing.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Revolving
      Loan Maturity Date</u>&#148; shall mean the date 364 days after the date of
      this Agreement (or, if extended pursuant to <u>Paragraph 2.02</u>, the
      date to which so extended).</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Revolving
      Loan Note</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph
      2.10(b)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Solvent</u>&#148;
      shall mean, with respect to any Person on any date, that on such date (a)
      the fair value of the property of such Person is greater than the fair
      value of the liabilities (including contingent, subordinated, matured and
      unliquidated liabilities) of such Person, (b) the present fair saleable
      value of the assets of such Person is greater than the amount that will be
      required to pay the probable liability of such Person on its debts as they
      become absolute and matured, (c) such Person does not intend to, and does
      not believe that it will, incur debts or liabilities beyond such Person&#146;s
      ability to pay as such debts and liabilities mature and (d) such Person is
      not engaged in or about to engage in business or transactions for which
      such Person&#146;s property would constitute an unreasonably small capital.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>SPC</u>&#148;
      shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph 8.05(d)</u>.</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<p align="center"><font size="2">17</font></p>
<hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">


<a name="page_18"></a>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <td width="4%"></td>
    <td width="96%"><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Subsidiary&#148;
      </u>of any Person shall mean (a) any corporation of which more than 50% of
      the issued and outstanding Equity Securities having ordinary voting power
      to elect a majority of the Board of Directors of such corporation
      (irrespective of whether at the time capital stock of any other class or
      classes of such corporation shall or might have voting power upon the
      occurrence of any contingency) is at the time directly or indirectly owned
      or controlled by such Person, by such Person and one or more of its other
      Subsidiaries or by one or more of such Person&#146;s other Subsidiaries, (b)
      any partnership, joint venture, limited liability company or other
      association of which more than 50% of the equity interest having the power
      to vote, direct or control the management of such partnership, joint
      venture or other association is at the time owned and controlled by such
      Person, by such Person and one or more of the other Subsidiaries or by one
      or more of such Person&#146;s other Subsidiaries or (c) any other Person
      whose results of operations are included in the Financial Statements of
      such Person on a consolidated basis.</font>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Surety
      Instruments</u>&#148; shall mean all letters of credit (including standby and
      commercial), banker&#146;s acceptances, bank guaranties, shipside bonds,
      surety bonds and similar instruments.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Taxes</u>&#148;
      shall have the meaning given to such term in <u>Subparagraph 2.14(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Telerate
      Page Rate</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>clause (a)(i)
      of the definition of &#147;LIBO Rate&#148; in Paragraph 1.01</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Term
      Loan</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph
      2.03(a)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Term
      Loan Borrowing</u>&#148; shall mean the borrowing by Borrower consisting of
      the Term Loans made by each of the Lenders on the Revolving Loan Maturity
      Date pursuant to the Notice of Term Loan Borrowing.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Term
      Loan Maturity Date</u>&#148; shall mean the date two years after the
      Revolving Loan Maturity Date.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Term
      Loan Note</u>&#148; shall have the meaning given to that term in <u>Subparagraph
      2.10(c)</u>.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Total
      Commitment</u>&#148; shall mean, at any time, the sum at such time of the
      Lenders&#146; Commitments.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Type</u>&#148;
      shall mean, with respect to any Loan, Borrowing or Portion at any time,
      the classification of such Loan, Borrowing or Portion by the type of
      interest rate it then bears, whether an interest rate based upon the Base
      Rate or the LIBO Rate.</font></p>
      <p><font size="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Unused</u>&#148;
      shall mean. with respect to the Commitments at any time, the remainder of
      (i) the Total Commitment at such time minus (ii) the aggregate principal
      amount of all Revolving Loans outstanding at such time.</font></td>
  </tr>
</TABLE>
<p align="center"><font size="2">18</font></p>
<hr noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
